results.title: Just do it
results.creator_credit: Sarah Hatherley, Jenny Livingston, Kim Snow and La Verite Films
results.brief_description: Two thirty-something women, Alice, an aspiring filmmaker, and Sandy, a student with a messy love life, meet regularly to walk around the domain. As they walk they talk about the state of their lives, yet, due especially to Sandy’s self-obsession and insensitivity, their conversations are less dialogues than therapeutic monologues. The tables are turned when Sandy’s unsympathetic response to her friend’s creative struggles, and her dismissive remark to ‘just do it’ have an unexpected outcome. Cast: Alison Whyte, Alice Garner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Hatherley, Jenny Livingston, Kim Snow and La Verite Films

results.title: Just call me Kade [NTSC]
results.brief_description: This documentary focuses on Kade Farlow Collins a teenage FTM (female to male transgendered person) residing in Tucson, Arizona. At the age of fourteen Kade (then Kate), supported by her family, began the process of transitioning from female to male. Drawing on his personal narrative the film follows Kade’s transition over a two year period. Friends and family candidly express their feelings about the transition, the changes in Kade and the impact on everyone involved. A moving story of some of the difficulties facing transgendered youth, as well as a portrayal of acceptance and understanding.

results.title: Just Australian trains
results.brief_description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.
results.description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.

results.title: Just another job
results.creator_credit: Pierre Letarte, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is professional hockey from the inside, an experience of the game that only the aspiring player can know. The film is about Les Nordiques de Quebec, the first truly French-Canadian professional hockey club. Coached at the start by superstar Maurice Richard, it is seen here playing its opening World Hockey Association game at the Quebec Coliseum. Vividly real is the pre-game tension, the on-ice action, where hopes rest on a flying puck, and, for one player at least, a dream realized in the inner office where big contracts are signed.

results.title: My favourite brunette
results.creator_credit: Elliott Nugent, Daniel Dare, Hope Enterprises and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Ronnie Jackson (Bob Hope), a prisoner in San Quentin awaiting the death sentence recounts how he went from baby photographer to detective when the tenant across the hall, detective McLeod (Alan Ladd in an unbilled role), goes away for the weekend leaving Jackson in charge of the phones. Enter the eponymous beautiful brunette, Baroness Carlotta Montay (Dorothy Lamour), who throws herself on the mercy of Jackson (whom she’s mistaken for McLeod) to locate her kidnapped Uncle. Living his dream profession, Jackson’s first case leads him to question whether Carlotta is schizophrenic, whether the missing man is her Uncle or husband, whether men in wheelchairs can walk, and why everyone is intent on securing the map that Carlotta has entrusted to him. Feature a knife wielding Peter Lorre and a dippy Lon Chaney as a henchman at a Sanitarium. This tongue in cheek take on hard boiled detective films in the vein of Raymond Chandler is one of Hope’s three “My favourite” films, the others being “My favourite blond” and “My favorite spy”.

results.title: My father, my master = Padre, padrone.
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Guiliani de Negri and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This brutal film is based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Gavino Ledda which describes his youth and early adulthood as a shepard in the barren hill region of Sardinia. As a five year old Gavino was forcibly removed from school by his harsh peasant father who treated his eldest son as violently as he had been treated by his father before him. The illiterate Gavino eventually joined the army and educated himself to a point where he could stand up to his father and reject ancestral tradition and expectation. Though influenced greatly by Italian neo-realism, “Padre Padrone” also incorporates elements of fantasy and magical realism to convey the epic sweep of Gavino’s story. The author appears as himself in the prologue and epilogue. Both harrowing and deeply humanist, “Padre Padrone” richly deserved the Palme D’Or it won at Cannes in 1977.

results.title: Cyclone Tracy
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: At Christmas 1974, Darwin was hit by Cyclone Tracy, which left a train of almost inconceivable destruction. This film shows the damage wrought, and people’s reactions during and after the cyclone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Noonan, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia

results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Rappeneau, Michel Seydoux, Rene Cleitman, D D Productions, Camera One, Hachette Premiere and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Edmond Rostand, this lavish version of the classic French romance comedy combines the breathtaking wit and poetry of the play with the colour and spectacle of a good costume drama. Gerard Depardieu is perfect as the charismatic Cyrano, whose enormous nose makes him feel unworthy to love his cousin Roxanne (Anne Brochet). When Roxanne confesses her love for handsome young cadet Christian de Neuvillette (Vincent Perez), Cyrano becomes a reluctant conduit for his love when he becomes the ‘voice’ for the inarticulate Christian. Soon Roxanne has fallen in love with Christian’s handsome looks, but also with the passionate poetry of his soul, which she doesn’t realise is Cyrano. In French with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of 1991 Academy Award for Best Costume Design and 1991 Golden Globe for Best Foreign Film)

results.title: My fair lady (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The dazzling film version of Lerner and Loewe’s acclaimed musical. Audrey Hepburn stars as the cockney flowergirl Eliza Doolittle who is trained by Professor Higgins (Rex Harrison) to pass as a duchess. Featuring sumptuous cinematography and costumes by Cecil Beaton, this is one of the most popular musicals ever filmed. Winner of eight Academy Awards including Best Picture. The original musical is based on George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”.

results.title: Misson to Mars
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Tom Jacobson and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The year is 2020 and the first manned mission to Mars, commanded by Luke Graham, lands safely on the red planet. But the Martian landscape harbours a bizarre and shocking secret that leads to a mysterious disaster so catastrophic, it decimates the crew. Haunted by a cryptic last message from Graham, NASA launches the Mars Recovery Mission to investigate and bring back survivors - if there are any. Features: Gary Sinise, Don Cheadle, and Tim Robbins. Music by Ennio Morricone.
